basics.name: Vaughn Gzenda
basics.label: Ph.D. Student
basics.summary: Ph.D. student interested in geometric mechanics, robotics and machine learning

work.name: Embodied Learning and Intelligence for eXploration and Innovative soft Robotics (ELIXIR) Lab, Toronto Metropolitan University
work.summary: Developing mathematical models for embodied cognition and locomotion for soft slender robotic systems.

work.name: Autonomous Space and Mechatronics (ASROM) Lab, Carleton University
work.summary: Developed mathematical models for small slip dynamics for wheeled robotic system and a recursive procedure to approximate and compensate the slip dynamics for trajectory tracking

work.name: Department of Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering, Carleton University
work.summary: Developed Mathematics Review Materials for seven undergraduate courses in the Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering Department. Created typeset notes on Linear Algebra, Calculus, Differential Equations, Complex Variables, etc., and quizzes for students.

work.name: Model Development Team, Canadian Western Bank
work.summary: Developed financial risk models. Received the Being Crucial Award for contributions.

publications.name: Recursive Input-Output Linearization for Slow-Fast Realization of Nonholonomic Hamiltonian Control Systems
publications.summary: In this paper, we study a slow-fast realization of nonholonomic Hamiltonian control systems mediated by strong friction forces...

publications.name: Wheeled mobile robots on rough terrains as stochastic nonholonomic systems
publications.publisher: IEEE Conference on Systems Man and Cybernetics
publications.summary: In this paper, we investigate the motion of wheeled mobile robots on rough terrains modeled as noisy nonholonomic constraints...

publications.name: Affine connection approach to the realization of nonholonomic constraints by strong friction forces
publications.summary: In this paper, we study an affine connection approach to realizing nonholonomic mechanical systems mediated by viscous friction forces...

publications.name: Integrability and chaos in figure skating
publications.summary: This paper explores integrable and chaotic behaviors in figure skating using geometric mechanics...
